rejection_reasons.issue: Static analysis outputs list zero findings without evidence of running or validation; no details on Slither or Aderyn execution beyond counts, and no validated findings or filtered false positives recorded.
rejection_reasons.required_fix: Provide summaries of the Slither and Aderyn runs (key alerts, validation decisions, and any false positives filtered) to demonstrate the tools were executed and findings assessed.

rejection_reasons.issue: Manual pattern hunting was not performed; manual_findings is empty and no code-level vulnerabilities are reported.
rejection_reasons.required_fix: Document manual code-level vulnerability review results, including any findings or an explicit statement of what areas were reviewed and outcomes.

rejection_reasons.issue: No severity classifications per Immunefi standards are provided for any finding (tool-based or manual).
rejection_reasons.required_fix: Assign Immunefi severity levels to each validated issue or explicitly note none found after validation.

rejection_reasons.issue: Dead-end analysis is missing; dead_ends_discovered is empty despite absence of findings, so false leads or dismissed alerts are undocumented.
rejection_reasons.required_fix: Record false positives or investigative branches that were explored and dismissed, explaining why they were dead ends.

critical: Add validated summaries of Slither and Aderyn outputs, including any findings reviewed and false positives filtered.
Perform and document manual pattern hunting with code-level vulnerability observations.
major: Apply Immunefi severity classifications (or explicitly state none found) for all validated findings.
Populate dead_ends_discovered with investigated false leads and rationale.

guidance: Pattern Hunter must run Slither and Aderyn, validate their alerts, perform manual pattern hunting for code-level issues, classify severities per Immunefi, and document dead ends. Ensure outputs are evidence-based and thorough.
resubmission_instructions: Address all critical and major issues above, then resubmit an updated Pattern Hunter report for cycle 0.
